alert.note: Alert for Onondaga; Seneca; Southern Cayuga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Seneca, northern Cayuga and Onondaga Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cayuga, or near Auburn, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Onondaga, Syracuse, Clay, Auburn, De Witt, Van Buren, Baldwinsville, North Syracuse, Seneca Falls and Solvay. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 90 between 35 and 39. New York Interstate 81 between 15 and 29 South. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
